note: Model will improve as more products analyzed and outcomes validated

rank_ordered.description: 4-tier margin evaluation: 16%+ STRONG GO, 15%+ GO, 10-15% SPECIAL REVIEW, <10% NO GO
rank_ordered.why_critical: Below 10% = auto-reject. 10-15% requires additional validation. 15%+ minimum for GO.
rank_ordered.measurement: Calculate at 700-unit full container, use flat-rate freight for bulky items

rank_ordered.description: Ability to compete against existing sellers (prefer Medium or weaker competition)
rank_ordered.why_critical: Very Strong competitors (96%+ page 1 coverage) extremely hard to displace
rank_ordered.measurement: DataDive competitor analysis: Very Strong vs Strong vs Medium vs Weak
success_indicators: Big brands with poor Amazon execution

rank_ordered.description: Ability to fulfill via FBA (or convert FBM to FBA)
rank_ordered.why_critical: FBA dramatically favored by algorithm for buy box win rate (60% improvement)
rank_ordered.measurement: Current FBA status, cost to convert, FBA fees acceptability

rank_ordered.description: Existing customer validation or ability to generate reviews
rank_ordered.why_critical: Reviews build trust, 4.5+ rating essential for conversion
rank_ordered.measurement: Current review count and rating if existing listing, review generation strategy if new
success_indicators: Clear path to generate reviews if new listing

rank_ordered.description: Revenue concentration in specific months and ability to manage off-season
rank_ordered.why_critical: 70-80% concentration in 4 months creates risk, but manageable with 50%+ margins
rank_ordered.measurement: Percentage of sales in peak months, off-season strategy
success_indicators: April launch timing feasible for May-August peak

rank_ordered.description: Market demand with limited availability creates pricing power
rank_ordered.why_critical: Supply gaps allow profitable pricing without aggressive price competition
rank_ordered.measurement: Availability of similar items, wait times, competitor stock status
success_indicators: Low PPC costs due to limited competition

rank_ordered.description: Ability to optimize shipping costs through allocation method or volume
rank_ordered.why_critical: Can swing product from non-viable to viable (especially bulky items)
rank_ordered.measurement: Compare cubic volume vs flat-rate allocation, full container vs small batch
success_indicators: Full container (700 units) reduces cost ~50% vs small batch
Multiple products in container allow cross-subsidization

rank_ordered.description: Authorization to sell branded products on Amazon
rank_ordered.why_critical: Total blocker - cannot proceed without approval
rank_ordered.measurement: Brand Registry status, authorization letters, PO requirements
success_indicators: No brand restrictions (unbranded or own brand)
failure_indicators: Brand approval pending with no resolution timeline

scoring_formula.calculation: Sum of (factor_score ร factor_weight) for all factors

score_interpretation.70_84: GO - Solid opportunity with manageable risks
score_interpretation.55_69: CONDITIONAL GO - Proceed with caution, additional validation needed
score_interpretation.40_54: WEAK GO / HOLD - Significant concerns, may not be viable
score_interpretation.0_39: NO GO - Too many risk factors, not recommended

confidence_multiplier.description: Overall confidence in recommendation based on data completeness
confidence_multiplier.high_80_100: Complete DataDive analysis, validated margins, clear competitive landscape
confidence_multiplier.medium_60_79: Good analysis but missing some data points

pattern_1_fbm_to_fba_conversion.description: FBM listing with good reviews converted to FBA
key_characteristics: Currently FBM with 0% buy box share
pattern_1_fbm_to_fba_conversion.expected_outcome: 60% buy box win rate after FBA conversion
pattern_1_fbm_to_fba_conversion.risk_level: Medium (established demand, but FBA conversion required)

pattern_2_supply_gap_exploitation.description: Market demand with limited current supply
key_characteristics: Specific replacement item not widely available
Complementary to products already sold (known customer base)

pattern_3_weak_competitor_displacement.description: Big brands with poor Amazon execution
key_characteristics: Poor Amazon listings (weak SEO, bad images)
Amazon buyers prioritize visual quality over brand (unless brand-searching)
Premium construction visible in photos justifies higher price
pattern_3_weak_competitor_displacement.expected_outcome: Can capture market share with superior listing optimization
pattern_3_weak_competitor_displacement.risk_level: Medium (brand recognition vs listing quality trade-off)

pattern_4_seasonal_high_margin.description: Seasonal product with 50%+ margins justifying concentrated risk
key_characteristics: Can maintain small inventory off-season to keep listing active
April launch timing achievable for May-August peak
pattern_4_seasonal_high_margin.expected_outcome: Profitable if seasonal window hit, margins absorb off-season costs

pattern_1_insufficient_margin.description: Product margin falls below viable thresholds

auto_reject_below_10: Margin <10% even at full container volume
special_review_10_to_15: Must show path to 15%+ (price increase, cost reduction)

decision_rules.10-15%: SPECIAL REVIEW - Needs additional validation and justification

pattern_1_insufficient_margin.exception: Strong market validation + clear path to 15% may allow CONDITIONAL GO for 10-15% products
examples: Product 90716 Coleman QuickPump (7.3% margin) = AUTO REJECT
Product 90708 SupportRest Twin (11.8% margin) = SPECIAL REVIEW needed

pattern_2_brand_approval_blocked.description: Cannot obtain authorization to sell branded products

pattern_3_dominated_market.description: Very Strong competitors with 96%+ page 1 coverage
key_characteristics: Established brands with thousands of reviews
No supply gaps or weaknesses to exploit
pattern_3_dominated_market.decision: NO GO or WEAK GO - Extremely difficult to gain traction
pattern_3_dominated_market.exception: If brand exclusivity or unique features provide edge

pattern_4_insurance_prohibitive.description: Product risk profile creates unacceptable insurance costs
key_characteristics: Major retailers require high coverage minimums
pattern_4_insurance_prohibitive.decision: Case-by-case (factor insurance cost into margin calculation)
pattern_4_insurance_prohibitive.exception: If margins high enough to absorb insurance costs

track_over_time.calculation: Correct GO/NO-GO predictions รท Total predictions

track_over_time.method: Increase weights for factors that predict success, decrease for less predictive factors

track_over_time.target: Identify new patterns as data grows

proceed_when: Target margins work out (16%+ STRONG GO, 15%+ GO)
Competitive advantage exists (features, pricing, FBA, exclusivity)
Market demand validated (competitor data, retail sales, reviews)
Listing strategy clear (use existing vs new, optimization plan)
Freight costs optimized (flat-rate vs cubic, full container)
Test batch makes sense financially (24-48 units for high-ticket)
hold_when: Brand approval pending with unclear timeline
Pricing viability unclear (waiting on final container costs)
special_review_when: Margins 10-15% - requires additional validation before decision
Path to 15%+ margin visible (price increase, cost reduction potential)
Strong market validation exists but margin borderline
reject_when: Margins unacceptable even with optimization (<10% = auto-reject)
Competition too strong (Very Strong competitors dominating)
Insurance prohibitive (no path to acceptable cost)
Supply chain consistency cannot be maintained (stockout risk)

objectives: Refine weights based on Todd's decisions
Auto-adjust weights based on prediction accuracy
Develop category-specific models (pool equipment vs camping vs fitness)
Predictive analytics (forecast product success before launch)
Risk modeling (probability distributions for revenue/margin scenarios)
Portfolio optimization (recommend product mix for container orders)
phase_4_autonomy.success_criteria: System provides strategic guidance beyond individual product analysis
